alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:28PM CDT until August 25 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PHILLIPS COUNTY... At 527 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Woodruff, or 14 miles north of Phillipsburg, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, at 505 PM CDT, a trained spotter estimated 50 MPH winds 8 miles southeast of Woodruff. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Phillips County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
